description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fudcl","text":"This protocol describes the expression of enzymes and creation of a master mix for recombinase polymerase amplification (RPA) assays.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"biq7m","text":"Dialyse the eluate with it's respective storage buffer. Follow the video in this link for instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"emgp9","text":"concentrate the elaute using a concentrator to required concentration (if your protein working concentration is 600ng/ul, atleast concentrate to 12-20 ug/ul)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mrj7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3367u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"60nkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4497A01DD5B511EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-2VpLNyeJ77YL-OqhpAGpTozjhJ-X8Tu?usp=sharing"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":33,"offset":192}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1m8tu","text":"The quickest way to measure the concentration is by measuring absorbance at 280nm (A280) using a nano drop. The extinction coefficient for the protein of interest can be measured online using Extinction coefficient calculator. Note that this method although considers the extinction coefficient of protein of interest, A280 values read are of all the protein in the sample. Hence, measuring accuracy depends on the purity of the sample. Accurate concentration can be also quickly measured using semi-quantitative SDS page (contact Smitha for python based tools for this).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"4433112FD5C211EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://web.expasy.org/protparam/"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhs8u","text":"Mix and load 6 ml of the resin (or any available Ni-NTA column) along with it's storage buffer and let the resin gravity settle. The millipore Ni-NTA agarose resin has 50% resin and the remaining 50% is loading buffer. So the column volume (CV) is 3ml in this case. Discard the flow through.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtk4t","text":"When the level of storage buffer reaches the top of the resin, equilibrate the column with following washes in sequence (i) 3 CV of MiliQ water (ii) 5 CV of 1X charge buffer. If your resin is precharged, skip this step (iii) 3 CV binding buffer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lfom","text":"Load the cell extract.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu53r","text":"Wash the column with 10 CV of binding buffer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0nsq","text":"Elute the bound protein through 10 CV of elute buffer, collect the eluate. Eluate can be stored in   until dialysed to storage buffer. The protein in eluate buffer is not stable for long in   or in the elution buffer, hence dialyse to storage buffer within a day or two of elution.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":99,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":190,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8h04","text":"Strip the Ni from the column using the stripping buffer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fa7n","text":"To re-use the resin same day , follow step 1 or Store column in 20% ethanol in ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"85vf7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18p9j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h6m3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CABCB020D5C111EBA20E478DB8FF0768","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E584EB70D5C111EBA20E478DB8FF0768","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"EFAED66DD5C111EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qf29","text":"The following day, centrifuge the culture by spinning down to maximum g force and then resuspend in   of 1X ice cold binding buffer. Add 25-40KU of lyzozyme per g of cells to break cell wall. Note: Benzonase addition can help break E.coli DNA. Novagen protocol suggests to avoid it as it could be in final purified protein. Hence, a suggestion is to avoid adding as it could possibly interfere in RPA and Cas 12 assays. note: addition of protease inhibitor is optional according to many protocols, add according to the manufacture's instructions.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"29ms6","text":"Sonicate on ice for few alternating cycles (30 cycles) of sonication and hold for   each.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ip7i","text":"Centrifuge the lysate at maximum g force, collect the supernatant and 0.22 um filter syringe to get rid of traces of cell debris that could otherwise clog the column. If you have no 0.22um filter, repeat spinning down the supernatant again and use the supernatant for further steps.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ohea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"0629D840D5B311EB93839FBC4B97ABB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":20,"guid":"333CDF4AD5B411EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qpuc","text":"Grow BL21 cells in LB media with appropriate antibiotics, overnight at  with shaking (for long term, store the pellets in  ). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":122,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fp9kl","text":"Inoculate   of the overnight culture to fresh   LB (whatever capacity required) with right concentration of antibiotics and continue growing at   whilst shaking.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":10,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":144,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"59qlf","text":"At ~ OD600 of 0.5, induce the expression of the gene using  IPTG and culture them at   overnight, with continuous aeration.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d03en","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foj5s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F7F52D20D5B111EB93839FBC4B97ABB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FCC552D0D5B111EB93839FBC4B97ABB9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"9A7D51BED5B211EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"9A7D5262D5B211EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9A7D5309D5B211EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"A56ADD25D5B211EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"6":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A56ADDBCD5B211EBAE6E0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"15","unit":10}}}}

100x","0.1"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cij53","text":"2x Reaction mix works faster with a final pH above 8.0 as the isolectric point of UvsY is around 7.8. Having at pH 8.0 in reaction buffer reduces the appearances of cloudy precipitated protein while making RPA mix, which predominatly was noted as UvsY.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"93bpi","text":"Certain combination of RPA primers work faster at 39-40C than 37C, so check the optimal temperature for the primer set","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ctb9","text":"Purity of the RPA enzymes does affect the speed of the reaction. An anion chromatography step following the Ni-NTA purification results in faster RPA reaction.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Low-cost recombinase polymerase amplification (RPA)
